column1: Happy New Year!  I am so thankful for the honor and privilege to serve the people of Florida’s 20th Congressional district.  Wishing everyone a happy and healthy year filled with peace love and joy.  #HappyNewYear2020 https://t.co/m0bTgs8FfC
Praying for my dear friend and colleague @repjohnlewis .  I know that he has a lot more fight left in him. Please keep John in your thoughts and prayers. https://t.co/fECKgvP1kl
Merry Christmas to all celebrating!! May today bring joy warmth and happiness while spending time with family and friends!! #Christmas
Wishing all who celebrate a very Happy Hanukkah and that the Festival of Lights brings much joy and happiness. Let us give thanks for the many blessings we enjoy.  #Hanukkah

Over 5 million people voted for #Amendment4 to restore voting rights for 1.4 million Floridians.  @RonDeSantisFL keeps appeal it & a judge said he’s ”trying to run out the clock” for the 2020 election.  Speak out and let your voice be heard!  #LetUsVoteFL
Retweet if you are part of the majority of Floridians who voted to protect voting rights and will not be silenced.  #LetUsVoteFL #flapol
ACT:  Justice delayed is justice denied. We need to act now to ensure that the voting rights of our fellow Floridians are restored.  Will you join me in speaking out on #Amendment4 ? #LetThemVoteFL
#LetUsVoteFL https://t.co/02hagkANI9
Please accept my warmest wishes to you and your families for a Happy Thanksgiving.(2/2)  #HappyThanksgiving #Thankful #FL20 #DedicatedToOurCommunity https://t.co/zRnbeJINkN

I am so thankful for the honor and privilege to represent the people of Florida’s 20th Congressional district in Congress.  During this holiday season may we remember the importance of family friends and our community. (1/2)

These brave men and women have dedicated their lives to freedom and democracyhere at home and around the world. We must remain committed to all of our troops their familiesand our veterans by honoring their service and sacrifice. 2/2  #VeteransDay #Veterans #SupportOurVeterans https://t.co/c4tXCadFoV

As we commemorate #VeteransDay I am so grateful to our nation’s veterans for their service and heroism.  Not only on this #VeteransDay but every day we must vow to never leave a veteran behind when they return home from the battlefield. (1/2)

Please make sure that your family friends neighbors and for that matter anyone you know register to vote. (2/2)  #FL20 #RegisterToVote #VoteBlue #GOTV #VOTE #DedicatedToOurCommunity https://t.co/2R2CATJqFH
I was pleased to join the @PBCDemParty last night as the featured speaker.  I can’t stress enough how important the 2020 election is for our state and nation. (1/2)

Looking forward to being the featured speaker for the @PBCDemParty monthly meeting.  The meeting will take place Thursday Nov. 7th from 7:00 - 9:00 PM at the South County Civic Center (16700 Jog Rd - Delray Beach). #FL20 #FLDemocrats #Democrats #GOTV #DedicatedToOurCommunity

I stand with #Eulen airport workers at FLL who are on STRIKE today for the unjust firing of Black and immigrant union activists. The right to organize is fundamental to our democracy. Eulen must do the right thing and rehire these workers immediately! #CancelEulen https://t.co/OGJ5M5e7xk
It will take place from 1:30 - 3:30 PM in room 144A at the Washington Convention Center. (2/2) https://t.co/TzUnUCgcbG

We MUST protect the fundamental right to vote to ensure at ALL Americans have an opportunity to have their voices heard!#VRA54  #RestoreTheVote #ProtectYourVote (3/3)  https://t.co/RAd9glbcbt
Sadly in the absence of federal enforcement of voting rights many states are making it even harder for people to vote.  (2/3)

The #VotingRightsAct was signed into law 54 years ago today.  However the Supreme Court’s 2013 ruling in Shelby County v. Holder invalidated key provisions of the #VotingRightsAct that had protected voters for decades in states with histories of voter discrimination. (1/3)

Trump’s attacks against my good friend and esteemed colleague Rep. Elijah Cummings are flat out racist and disgusting! Rep. Cummings fights tirelessly every single day for his constituents and our nation. 1/2
Today we celebrate our nation’s birthday.  Wishing a safe and happy 4th of July to all.  Happy Independence Day! #IndependenceDay #July4th https://t.co/91yXxmtlx5

I am not backing down and ready for the fight ahead in 2020.  I would be humbled for your support. I hope that we can stand together and make our voices heard! I remain Tried-and-True Dedicated to You and Our Community! #FL20 #DedicatedToOurCommunity  https://t.co/p5YEyfuVd8

@KamalaHarris is the right choice to lead our nation. We live in historically troubling times and are in desperate need of leadership that exemplifies courage conviction and moral clarity. Kamala has delivered results for the American people at every level of government  1/3

toward a future free from hate and fear.  The House passed #HR8 & #HR1112.  Now it is time for the Senate to act!  We must continue our fight so that every family across our nation can live free from the fear of gun violence.  #Pulse #LGBTQ #OrlandoStrong #HonorThemWithAction

Three years ago today 49 innocent lives were lost to a horrifying and devastating mass shooting at the #PulseNightClub in Orlando.  As we mark LGBTQ Pride Month and Gun Violence Prevention Month let us honor their memories and remain steadfast in our commitment in working 1/2
I stand with the entire Virginia Beach community during this time of great sadness. #EndGunViolence #EnoughIsEnough  https://t.co/WEzLUCtWp1

The tragic shooting yesterday in Virginia Beach has sadly left yet another community devastated and heartbroken. We must address the gun violence epidemic facing our nation. The House passed a bipartisan commonsense gun violence prevention bill. It’s time for the Senate to act!
It is imperative that we work together to build a more just and equal future for all Americans.  #LGBTQ #PrideMonth #Equality https://t.co/qnjwkqfG6r

Today we mark the start of LGBTQ Pride Month and the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall Riots.  While we have made great strides toward LGBTQ equality we must continue to raise awareness of the work that still needs to be done and the issues that the LGBTQ community still face.

I was proud to cast my vote yesterday in support of the #EqualityAct  - a bill that will ensure LGBTQ Americans are guaranteed the full protections of federal civil rights law.  Let’s be clear! No American should be denied housing the ability to attend school 1/3
Today I Congradulate the State of Israel on its 71st Anniversary of  Independance. We also celebrate the close and special relationship between our two countries.
Today I take a moment to remember the six million Jews who perished during the Holocaust and the valient and heroic acts of the Survivors. #NeverAgain #YomHashoah #HolocaustRememberance

Today is #EarthDay!  We must do all that we can to protect our planet.  There is no other option.  It’s time for #ClimateActionNow.  Our future relies on preservation for our land waters and wildlife.  #EarthDay https://t.co/OLe3ADqCTk

I was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of my dear friend Maude Ford Lee. If there is such a thing as a community servant then Maude was a genuine community servant. She’ll be remembered as a legend in terms of bringing resources to the whole community 1/2

I condemn in the strongest possible terms this act of terrorism racism and hate.  This type of vitriolic xenophobia has no place in our society.  I offer my deepest sympathies to the people of New Zealand during this devastating time of sadness.  #NewZealand 2/2

My heart goes out to the Christchurch community who were devastated by a senseless hate-filled terror attack targeting the Al Noor and Linwood Mosques.  Forty-nine innocent lives were lost and at least 48 people have sustained injuries including children.  1/2

Today I cast my vote in favor of the #ForThePeopleAct to bring greater transparency  accountability back to Washington.  It’s far past time that we ensure hard working and working poor Americans are at the heart of the policy-making process. 1/2

This week I joined @RepAOC and U.S. Senator Ed Markey as an original co-sponsor of the #GreenNewDeal. Climate change is real and not debatable. No region of our country and no sector of our economy will be spared.

Democrats have been very clear that we are prepared to negotiate on border security and immigration policy but only when President Trump and Republicans open the goverment.  #EndTheShutdown  https://t.co/HYPI7QueTN

It’s day 30 of the #TrumpShutdown - the longest in U.S.government history. In his latest shutdown speech the President offered a set of unacceptable initiatives and completely failed to mention sympathy for the hundreds of thousands of federal employees not receiving a paycheck
